alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 6:16AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Pulaski and Rockcastle. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Vernon, Science Hill, Bee Lick, Quail, Willailla, Bandy, Ottowa, Bromo, Woodstock, Indian Lakes Park, Spiro, Gum Sulphur, Maretburg, Bobtown, Hiatt, Lake Linville, Renfro Valley, Roundstone, Wildie and Conway.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
